page.title: 14 Beccles Church Tower.
page.content: The Tower of St Michaels Parish Church is built apart from the main church because the land is not firm enough to hold its weight near Puddingmoor.It was bought in 1972 with a 1795 penny. $68,000 was raised to pay for exterior restoration.It is 95 feet high and if one climbs the spiral stairs one can see the bell chamber and 10 bells. The tower is 15C. and of interest are buried in the churchyard-Rev. Edmund Nelson and Catharine Suckling,parents of Horatio Lord Nelson.Also buried are George Crabbe the poet and Sarah Elmy of Beccles.[Mira]. From the top fine views of the River Waveney,Norfolk marshes and the old towns rooftops can be found.There is a safety rail around the top now!
